description: From French défroquer, from dé- + froc. By surface analysis, de- +‎ frock.

verbs.description: defrock (third-person singular simple present defrocks, present participle defrocking, simple past and past participle defrocked)

entries.meaning: (figuratively) To formally remove the rights and authority of a member of the clergy.
examples: The defrocked priest may no longer perform rites.

entries.meaning: (by extension) To formally remove the rights and authority of someone, e.g. a government official or a medical practitioner.
